bot_online: gem-bot is now online. Use `!help` to see available commands.
model_usage:
Usage:
`!model list` - List available models
`!model set` - Change the model
history_usage:
Usage:
`!history list [start] [count]` - List conversation history with message numbers
`!history delete <number>` - Delete a message by number
`!history clear` - Clear all conversation history
`!history export [filename]` - Export conversation history as Markdown
prompt_usage:
Usage:
`!prompt show` - Show current system prompt
`!prompt set <content>` - Set system prompt
`!prompt append <content>` - Append to system prompt
`!prompt clear` - Clear system prompt
`!prompt download` - Download system prompt
prompt_updated_from_file: System prompt updated from uploaded GEMINI.md file.
prompt_file_decode_error: Error: Could not decode GEMINI.md file. Please ensure it is UTF-8 encoded.
config_usage:
Usage:
`!config show` - Show current settings
`!config set <key> <value>` - Change a setting
`!config reset [key]` - Reset settings
branch_usage:
Usage:
`!branch create <name>` - Create a new branch and switch to it
`!branch switch <name>` - Switch to a branch
`!branch list` - List all branches
`!branch merge <name>` - Merge a branch
`!branch delete <name>` - Delete a branch
history_delete_usage:
Usage: `!history delete <number>`
Use `!history list` to see message numbers.
help_command_create: Create a new branch from the current conversation and switch to it.
help_command_merge: Merge another branch into the current branch.
help_command_list: List history with numbers. Optional [start] [count] for range. Defaults to last 10.
help_command_delete: Delete a message and its pair from history.
help_command_clear: Clear all conversation history for this channel.
help_command_export: Export conversation history as a Markdown file.
help_command_prompt_append: Append text to the system prompt.
help_command_image: Generate an image from a text prompt.
model_select_description:
Currently using: **{model}**

Enter a number to select a model.
Type `cancel` to cancel.
model_select_invalid_number:
Invalid number. Enter a number between 1 and {max}.
Type `cancel` to cancel.
command_not_found: Command `{command}` not found. Use `!help` to see available commands.
help_command_set: Interactively select the Gemini model to use.
help_bot_description:
A Discord bot powered by Gemini API with Git-based conversation branching.

Just type a message (without `!` prefix) to chat with Gemini.
help_ending_note: Type {prefix}{command} <command> for more info on a command.
google_usage:
Usage:
`!google link` - Link your Google account
`!google unlink` - Unlink your account
`!google status` - Check connection status
google_setup_file_not_found:
`credentials.json` file not found.
Download it from Google Cloud Console and place it in the project root.
google_setup_invalid_json:
`credentials.json` has invalid JSON format.
Please re-download from Google Cloud Console.
google_setup_wrong_format:
`credentials.json` has incorrect format.
Create the OAuth client ID as a "Desktop app".
google_setup_missing_fields:
`credentials.json` is missing required fields.
Please re-download from Google Cloud Console.
google_setup_steps:
1. Create a project in Google Cloud Console
2. Enable Google Calendar API
3. Configure OAuth consent screen
4. Create OAuth client ID (Desktop app)
5. Download JSON and rename to `credentials.json`
6. Place in project root and restart the bot
google_already_linked: Your Google account is already linked. Use `!google unlink` first to re-link.
google_link_check_dm: An authentication URL has been sent to your DMs. Please check.
google_link_url:
Click the following URL to authenticate with Google:
{url}
google_link_success: {user}'s Google account has been linked successfully!
google_link_timeout: Authentication timed out. Please run `!google link` again.
google_unlink_success: Your Google account has been unlinked.
google_not_linked: Your Google account is not linked.
google_status_connected: Connected - Your Google account is linked.
google_status_hint: Use `!google link` to connect your Google account.
mode_usage:
`!mode default` - Switch to default mode (Google Search)
`!mode calendar` - Switch to Calendar mode
`!mode todo` - Switch to Todo mode (Google Tasks)
mode_calendar_not_linked: To use Calendar mode, please link your Google account first with `!google link`.
mode_todo_not_linked: To use Todo mode, please link your Google account first with `!google link`.
mode_instruction_default: [SEARCH MODE] You are an assistant that provides accurate information. When answering user questions, always use Google Search to retrieve the latest and most accurate information. Do not rely solely on your pre-trained knowledge; always base your answers on search results. Use only information contained in search results and do not supplement with speculation or guesswork. Do not include URLs directly in your response. Instead, indicate sources using bracketed numbers like [1], [2]. The backend will link these to metadata.
mode_instruction_todo: [TODO MODE] You are an assistant that manages user tasks using Google Tasks. When users ask about tasks, TODOs, or to-do lists, or request to add, complete, delete, or list tasks, always use the provided Google Tasks functions (list_tasks, create_task, complete_task, delete_task, etc.). Always call the tools instead of responding with plain text.
mode_instruction_calendar: [CALENDAR MODE] You are an assistant that manages user schedules using Google Calendar. When users ask about events, schedules, or calendar, or request to add, modify, delete, or check events, always use the provided Google Calendar functions.
tasks_func_list_task_lists_desc: Get the user's Google Tasks task lists. Use this to check what lists are available.
tasks_func_list_tasks_desc: Get tasks from a task list. Use this to check TODOs or things to do.
tasks_func_create_task_desc: Create a new task. Use this to add TODOs or items to the to-do list.
tasks_func_update_task_desc: Update an existing task. Use this to change task content, due dates, etc.
tasks_func_complete_task_desc: Mark a task as completed. Use this when a TODO is done or a task is finished.
tasks_func_delete_task_desc: Delete a task. Use this to remove tasks that are no longer needed.
tasks_param_max_results_10: Maximum number of results to retrieve (default: 10)
tasks_param_max_results_100: Maximum number of results to retrieve (default: 100)
tasks_param_tasklist_id: Task list ID. Uses the default list (@default) if omitted.
tasks_param_tasklist_id_default: Task list ID. Uses the default list if omitted.
tasks_param_show_completed: Whether to show completed tasks (default: false)
tasks_param_due: Due date (RFC 3339 format, e.g., 2024-01-15T00:00:00.000Z). Append T00:00:00.000Z for date-only values.
tasks_param_task_id_update: ID of the task to update
tasks_param_task_id_complete: ID of the task to mark as complete
tasks_param_task_id_delete: ID of the task to delete
tasks_not_authenticated: Google account is not linked. Please link with `!google link`.
calendar_func_list_events_desc: Get events from the user's Google Calendar. Use this to check today's, tomorrow's, or this week's events.
calendar_func_create_event_desc: Create a new event in Google Calendar. Use this to add meetings, events, reminders, etc.
calendar_func_update_event_desc: Update an existing event. Use this to change event time, title, etc.
calendar_param_time_min: Start time for retrieval (ISO 8601 format, e.g., 2024-01-15T00:00:00+09:00). Defaults to current time if omitted.
calendar_param_time_max: End time for retrieval (ISO 8601 format). No limit if omitted.
calendar_param_max_results: Maximum number of results to retrieve (default: 10)
calendar_param_start_time: Start time (ISO 8601 format, e.g., 2024-01-15T10:00:00+09:00) or date only (e.g., 2024-01-15)
calendar_param_end_time: End time (ISO 8601 format) or date only. For all-day events, specify the next day's date.
calendar_param_event_id_update: ID of the event to update
calendar_param_event_id_delete: ID of the event to delete
calendar_not_authenticated: Google account is not linked. Please link with `!google link`.
